Type.Name: Notebook

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Notebook extends Gtk.Container

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.param: The to use as the contents of the page.
The to be used as the label for the page, or to use the default label, 'page N'.
Docs.summary: Appends a page.
Docs.returns: A specifying the index (starting from 0) of the appended page in the notebook, or -1 if the method fails.

remarks.para: Appends a page to notebook. The tab widget is the and the content is .
Don't forget to call the Show method on the widget or else the new page will not be shown.

MemberSignature.Value: public int AppendPageMenu (Gtk.Widget child, Gtk.Widget tab_label, Gtk.Widget menu_label);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 AppendPageMenu(class Gtk.Widget child, class Gtk.Widget tab_label, class Gtk.Widget menu_label) cil managed

Docs.param: The to use as the contents of the page.
The to be used as the label for the page, or to use the default label, 'page N'.

The widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu, if its enabled. If is passed, and is a or , then the menu label will be a newly created label with the same text as ; If is not a , must be specified if the page-switch menu is to be used.
Docs.summary: Appends a page, with a custom popup-label.

remarks.para: Appends a page to notebook, specifying the widget to use as the label in the popup menu.
Don't forget to call the Show method on the widget or else the new page will not be shown.

Docs.summary: Signaled when a request is made to change the current page

remarks.para: This event is raised when a request is made to change the current page in the notebook.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Sets or obtains the index of the curent page.
Docs.value: Returns the index of the current page .
Docs.remarks: The index (starting from 0) of the current page in the notebook. If the notebook has no pages, then -1 will be returned.

Docs.summary: Obtains the widget that represents the current page.
Docs.value: The object in the current page.

remarks.para: This property uses and together to provide a quicker way of getting the current page widget.

Docs.summary: Indicates if the popup menu is enabled.
Docs.value: Returns true if the popup menu is enabled and false if not.
Docs.remarks: if true and the user clicks with the right mouse button on the tabs, a menu with all the pages will be popped up.

Docs.summary: Signaled when a Tab is focused

remarks.para: This event is raised when a tab has been focused.

MemberSignature.Value: public int InsertPage (Gtk.Widget child, Gtk.Widget tab_label, int position);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 InsertPage(class Gtk.Widget child, class Gtk.Widget tab_label, int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: The to use as the contents of the page.
The to be used as the label for the page, or to use the default label, 'page N'.
The index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page after all other pages.
Docs.summary: Inserts a page into the notebook at the given position.

remarks.para: Insert a page into the notebook at the given position.
Don't forget to call the Show method on the widget or else the new page will not be shown.

MemberSignature.Value: public int InsertPageMenu (Gtk.Widget child, Gtk.Widget tab_label, Gtk.Widget menu_label, int position);

Docs.param: The to use as th content of the page.
the to use as a label. use null for the default label.
the to use as menu label. use null to get the same label as the tab label, this only works if the tab label is a
the zero-based position to insert the page. use -1 make it the last page.
Docs.summary: Insert a page into notebook at the given position, with a custom popup-label.

remarks.para: Don't forget to call the Show method on the widget or else the new page will not be shown.

Docs.summary: Changes the position of a widget in the notebook.

remarks.para: Reorders the page containing , so that it appears in position position. If position is greater than or equal to the number of children in the list or negative, will be moved to the end of the list.

Docs.summary: Raised when a tab is reordered.
Indicates if scroll arrows are added if there are too many tabs.
Docs.value: Returns true if arrows are added and false if not.
